description:
The Hungarian philosopher IstvÃ¡n MÃ©szÃ¡ros has been in Brazil for a series of conferences titled around his new work "The mountain we must climb: Reflections on the State" (2015), which has just been published.

The Hungarian philosopher went through Sao Paulo, Marilia, Belo Horizonte and GoiÃ¢nia, and launched the Brazilian edition of his classic "The concept of dialectics in Lukacs', along with the long-awaited Brazilian edition of the second volume of" To an ontology of social being " , GyÃ¶rgy LukÃ¡cs, intellectual and political mentor MÃ©szÃ¡ros.

In this interview, granted to the TV UFMG circuit program, MÃ©szÃ¡ros discusses the role of the thought of Lukacs for their training and for Marxism of the century, stressing the importance of the monumental "ontological" project, the mature Lukacs.

Mediated Isabella Melano, MÃ©szÃ¡ros also responded to provocations of teachers and researchers Miguel Vedda and Leonardo de Deus, diagnosing the structural crisis of capitalism and the difficult but necessary task of the left today.
